channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Indicted German Financier Freed in Italy
item.description: Florian Homm, arrested last year on a United States warrant, was released from prison and returned to Germany, his lawyer said.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING
item.media:description: Florian Homm appearing on German television in 2013.

item.title: Bergdahl’s Life Was in Immediate Danger, Officials Say
item.description: Officials tell senators Congress was not informed of an impending prisoner swap as quick action was needed to save a soldier’s life from a Taliban threat.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Exiled Tiananmen Protest Leader Says He Slipped Into China
item.description: The return of Zhou Fengsuo, who helped lead the 1989 protests, came despite China’s intensified security measures on the anniversary of the crackdown.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW JACOBS

item.title: Top Dutch Aerospace Firm Settles Sanctions Violations
item.description: Fokker Technologies had been accused of more than 1,150 violations of American sanctions on Iran and Sudan through the illicit sale of aircraft parts.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Germany Begins Inquiry of U.S. in Surveillance Case
item.description: After pressure from members of Parliament, Germany’s federal prosecutor announced a formal investigation into the tapping of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s cellphone.
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE

item.title: World Briefing: International Criminal Court to Focus on Sex Crimes
item.description: For the first time, the court’s statute included rape, sexual slavery, and other forms of sexual violence as crimes against humanity and war crimes.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By MARLISE SIMONS

item.title: The Global Game: Australia, the World Cup’s Unluckiest Country
item.description: The Socceroos must beat some of the toughest teams around to advance.
item.dc:creator: By GREGOR AISCH and DAVID LEONHARDT
item.media:description: Members of Australia's soccer team arriving at the airport in Sydney on their way to Brazil for the World Cup.

item.title: Open Source: Al Jazeera Journalists Speak From Behind Bars in Cairo
item.description: An Australian correspondent and an Egyptian producer for the Qatari network called the charges against them an indictment of routine journalism.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Obama Warns an Absent Russia of Broader Sanctions
item.description: President Obama said Russia has about a month to reverse its intervention in Ukraine, or it will face broader international sanctions.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: President Obama with other Group of 7 leaders on Thursday in Brussels.

item.title: Bergdahl Walked Away Before, Military Report Says
item.description: A classified report on the Army’s investigation into Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl’s disappearance in June 2009 says he had left assigned areas before and then returned, according to people briefed on it.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and ERIC SCHMITT

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: June 5
item.description: The World Environment Day is celebrated every year to spread awareness about pressing environmental issues.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: A worker moving through a pile of empty plastic bottles at a recycling workshop in Mumbai, Maharashtra, on World Environment Day.

item.title: Matter: Putting a Price Tag on Nature’s Defenses
item.description: A new study estimates the trillions of dollars of protection that ecosystems provide, although not everyone buys the premise.
item.dc:creator: By CARL ZIMMER
item.media:description: Coral reefs have proved valuable to coastal regions by helping to blunt shore erosion from storm waves.

item.title: Lens Blog: Iran Offers a Window to the West
item.description: Given a chance – and a week – to visit Iran, John Moore took to the road in central Iran to see daily life in a place that has opened a bit to the West.
item.category: The New York Times Lens Blog
item.dc:creator: By JOHN MOORE
item.media:description: Qom, Iran. Clerics speaking in a hotel coffee shop before prayers at an Islamic shrine. June 3.

item.title: Washington Memo: Bergdahl Case Shakes Democrats’ Confidence in Administration
item.description: President Obama’s handling of the prisoner exchange has renewed frustration among congressional Democrats about the administration’s relations with its allies on Capitol Hill.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By CARL HULSE

item.title: India Ink: Newly Elected Parliamentarians Take Oath in Sanskrit
item.description: An usually high number of lawmakers took their oaths in Sanskrit on the second day of the new Parliament session in New Delhi.
item.dc:creator: By HARI KUMAR
item.media:description: Sushma Swaraj, India's external affairs minister, arriving to attend the first day of the Parliament session in New Delhi on Wednesday.

item.title: Concern for Health of Bowe Bergdahl Drove Prisoner Exchange
item.description: An Obama administration divided over a prisoner swap that would free five Taliban commanders swept those issues aside in the rush to secure Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By MARK MAZZETTI, ERIC SCHMITT, DAVID E. SANGER and HELENE COOPER
item.media:description: A sign outside Zaney’s, a coffee shop in Hailey, Idaho, announced Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl’s release.

item.title: India Ink: In West Bengal, Communists’ Defeat Signals a Larger Loss
item.description: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) was reduced to just two seats in West Bengal, a state that was formerly the source of its national power.
item.dc:creator: By VAIBHAV VATS
item.media:description: Supporters of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) at an election rally in Kolkata, West Bengal, in May.

item.title: Washington Memo: Bergdahl Case Shakes Democrats’ Confidence in Administration
item.description: President Obama’s handling of the prisoner exchange has renewed frustration among congressional Democrats about the administration’s relations with its allies on Capitol Hill.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By CARL HULSE

item.title: Lens Blog: Missing Japan, Balanced in Brazil
item.description: Among the first generation of Japanese laborers who immigrated to Brazil more than a century ago, Haruo Ohara photographed a world where man sought harmony with tradition and nature.
item.category: The New York Times Lens Blog
item.dc:creator: By JEAN-PHILIPPE DEDIEU

item.title: Police Hunt Killer of Canadian Officers
item.description: The authorities in New Brunswick said they believed that they had identified the man who killed three Mounties and wounded two others.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN
item.media:description: Canadian police officers took cover behind vehicles in Moncton, New Brunswick on Wednesday during the hunt for a man who shot and killed three members of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

item.title: European Central Bank Takes a Radical Step
item.description: The central bank, trying to kick-start the sluggish euro zone economy and hold off deflation, will charge commercial banks to store their money.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING
item.media:description: Mario Draghi, president of the European Central Bank.

item.title: New Israeli Settlement Plans Draw Swift Condemnation
item.description: Israel said the proposal for about 1,500 units was a response to the creation of a unity Palestinian government.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Dozens Are Sentenced on Terrorism Charges in Xinjiang
item.description: The accused were convicted on charges including intentional murder, arson and participating in terrorist activities, with nine people sentenced to death.
item.dc:creator: By DAN LEVIN

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Don’t Annex the West Bank
item.description: A fringe idea is becoming politically kosher in Israel, and it could be disastrous for the country’s future.
item.dc:creator: By SHMUEL ROSNER

item.title: Philippines Reports Chinese Ship Movement Around Disputed Reefs
item.description: Philippine officials said Chinese ships were photographed near two areas in the South China Sea that could be used to reclaim land and build structures.
item.dc:creator: By FLOYD WHALEY
